body:
I paired on the original implementation of the divider and had the desire to add the divider to rails in the first place, I can say with certainty that the original implementors did not intend to have the divider_on_first in the first place.

It was something I expected rails to already do when I had to add a option group to a select on my project, so I was surprised when rails did not already have it. My app's implementation generated a collection without the divider_on_first, but our first patch unfortunately was incorrect.

I think divider is simple and self evident as to outcome. If it gets more complicated I agree we should not try to put up with that complexity in rails. Personally I more frequently use dividers, I rarely put real human readable labels on grouped options and more often than not use the label as a divider. If anything, consider also removing the ability to label grouped options as you could easily generate your own markup for that.
